text.0: two perfect springs of heat pervade the threefold and come for their delight is mātariśvan.
text.1: craving the milk of heaven the gods are present well do they know the praisesong and the sāman.
text.2: the priests beard far away as they are ordered serve the three nirrtis for well they know them.
text.3: sages have traced the cause that first produced them dwelling in distant and mysterious chambers.
text.4: the youthful one wellshaped with four locks braided brightened with oil puts on the ordinances.
text.5: two birds of mighty power are seated near her there where the deities receive their portion.
text.6: one of these birds hath passed into the sea of air thence he looks round and views this universal world.
text.7: with simple heart i have beheld him from anear his mother kisses him and he returns her kiss.
text.8: him with fair wings though only one in nature wise singers shape with songs in many figures.
text.9: while they at sacrifices fix the metres they measure out twelve chalices of soma.
text.10: while they arrange the four and sixandthirty and duly order up to twelve the measures.
text.11: having disposed the sacrifice thoughtful sages send the car forward with the rc and sāman.
text.12: the chariots majesties are fourteen others seven sages lead it onward with their voices.
text.13: who will declare to us the ford apnana the path whereby they drink first draughts of soma.
text.14: the fifteen lauds are in a thousand places that is as vast as heaven and earth in measure.
text.15: a thousand spots contain the mighty thousand vāk spreadeth forth as far as prayer extendeth.
text.16: what sage hath learned the metres application who hath gained vāk the spirits aim and object.
text.17: which ministering priest is called eighth hero who then hath tracked the two bay steeds of indra.
text.18: yoked to his chariotpole there stood the coursers they only travel round earths farthest limits.
text.19: these when their driver in his home is settled receive the allotted meed of their exertion.
